business.headline: Should you buy LIC shares after Q2 results? Here's what brokerages suggestLIC reported a 4% year-on-year (YoY) decline in standalone net profit, amounting to Rs 7,621 crore for the quarter ending September 2024.
Sensex, Nifty close flat amid volatile trading; Asian Paints down 8%The S&P BSE Sensex added 9.83 points to close at 79,496.15, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 6.90 points to end at 24,141.30.

Flipkart, Amazon under scrutiny for foreign investment violations: ReportWalmart-owned Flipkart and Amazon, both of which are experiencing rapid growth in India's Rs 70 billion e-commerce market, face rising regulatory scrutiny.

JSW Holdings shares hit all-time high, surging 70% in just 4 sessionsJSW Holdings Ltd shares: The rally has positioned the stock as one of the year's top performers, delivering multibagger returns with a 228.18% rise on a year-to-date (YTD) basis.
Goodbye, Vistara: Airline set for final flight today as it merges with Air IndiaThe Vistara airline began its operations on January 9, 2015, with an inaugural flight from Delhi to Mumbai.
Bitcoin rallies past $81,000. What's driving the surge?Bitcoin surged past $81,000 for the first time, hitting a record high on Monday with its market cap reaching $1.6 trillion.
Rupee plunges to all-time low of 84.38 against US dollarThe rupee dropped to a new low of 84.3875 in early trading, surpassing its previous record set last Friday.
Swiggy IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check status Swiggy IPO allotment: Investors can check their allotment status by logging in to the BSE website or the registrar Link Intime India's portal.
Sensex, Nifty open flat despite gains in IT and auto stocks The S&P BSE Sensex was down 48.63 points to 79,437.69, while the Nifty50 lost 20.40 points to 24,127.80.

Ruchir Sharma on why billionaires support 'crazy capitalist' Donald TrumpDespite his 'crazy capitalist' persona, Donald Trump's pro-business approach continues to win over America's influential elites and billionaires.

Cryptocurrencies here to stay as an asset class, says Ruchir SharmaIn an interview with India Today News Director Rahul Kanwal, Ruchir Sharma explained why cryptocurrencies, alongside gold, are emerging as long-term alternatives to traditional assets, particularly the US dollar.

China's stimulus may stabilise economy, but won't solve crisis: Ruchir SharmaIn an interview with India Today News Director Rahul Kanwal, Ruchir Sharma highlighted that China's growth is unlikely to exceed 2.5% annually over the next decade.

Only a weaker dollar will bring foreign investors back to India: Ruchir SharmaIn an interview with India Today News Director Rahul Kanwal, Ruchir Sharma explained that the primary factor hindering foreign capital inflows into India is the strength of the dollar.

Should India worry about Donald Trump's tariff plans? Ruchir Sharma explainsRuchir Sharma warned that under Donald Trump, India must brace for a more transactional approach, where deals could be made based on America's interests.

Booking plans job cuts as part of company's reorganisation planBooking Holdings, which owns brands like Booking.com and Kayak, did not disclose how many jobs would be affected but said it expected to provide more details on timing, likely impact on employees and financials "in due course".

Elon Musk's Tesla hits $1 trillion market value after Trump winThe electric automaker's shares jumped 8.2 per cent to $321.22, catapulting the company's valuation above the trillion-dollar mark for the first time in more than two years.

A woman's soulmate is another woman: Kalli Purie at Business Today MPW 2024Kalli Purie, Vice-Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief, India Today Group, delivered the vote of thanks at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 awards.

Watch: Trailblazers awarded at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024Business Today unveiled the 21st edition of its Most Powerful Women in Business list on Friday, celebrating 60 exceptional women leaders who are pioneering change, driving growth, and inspiring progress across diverse industries. This year's edition brings in 12 fresh faces and recognises four returning achievers, underscoring the dynamic nature of leadership in business. Watch the award ceremony here on India Today.

I salute the trailblazers: Kalli Purie at Business Today's Most Powerful Women eventKalli Purie, Vice-Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief, India Today Group, lauded the growing accomplishments and transformation of women leaders in India.

Trailblazers on Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 listThis year's Business Today Most Powerful Women list introduces 12 new faces, four returning achievers, and 37 repeat honourees from last year. Two trailblazers entered the MPW Hall of Fame after seven-time wins.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Karnataka Minister's 'racist' remark against HD Kumaraswamy sparks rowKarnataka Minorities Minister Zameer Ahmed Khan ignited controversy by referring to Union Minister HD Kumaraswamy as 'Kaaliya', a comment criticised as racist and derogatory by Janata Dal (Secular) and the BJP.

No transfer of land to 'infiltrators' who marry tribal women in Jharkhand: Amit ShahAddressing a poll rally, Amit Shah assured that the BJP, if voted to power in Jharkhand, will bring a tough law to stop land transfer to infiltrators who marry tribal girls.

'Did you inspect bags of PM?' Uddhav Thackeray claims his bags checked at rallyThe video, presumably shot by Uddhav Thackeray himself, shows him asking the poll officials whether they inspect the bags of PM Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah when they come to Maharashtra to address rallies.

Will Kamala Harris become president despite losing to Trump? Will that be right?While Kamala Harris has conceded defeat in the US elections, a section of Democrats are asking Joe Biden to step down and give the US its first woman President. While Harris is running the administration for all practical purposes, almost acting as the President of the US (POTUS), will it be fair on Americans to thrust upon a candidate who lost the popular vote?

Your loofah is a hotspot for germs, but don't just ditch itUsing a loofah in the shower can be soothing, but it's time to consider the germs this bath staple may be harbouring while it sits in your bathroom.

10 militants killed in Manipur after they attack military camp, 1 jawan injuredThe armed militants had also attacked the Borobekra Police Station and set three-four abandoned houses belonging to the Meitei community in Jakuradhor, on fire.

Khalistani terrorist Pannun threatens attack on Ram Mandir, other templesIn a video released by the banned Sikhs for Justice (SFJ) outfit, Gurpatwant Singh Pannun warned of an attack on November 16 and 17.

KL Rahul explains reason behind LSG exit: Wanted to start fresh, needed freedomFormer Lucknow Super Giants captain KL Rahul has explained the reason behind leaving the franchise. Rahul said that he wanted to play with freedom and needed to make a fresh start after 3 seasons at LSG.

Indira denied Justice HR Khanna CJI's job 50 years ago. His nephew is CJI nowJustice Sanjiv Khanna took oath as the Chief Justice of India (CJI) on Monday. About 50 years ago, Justice HR Khanna, Sanjiv Khanna's uncle and then the senior-most SC judge, was denied the CJI's post by then Prime Minister Indira Gandhi. A look into why Justice HR Khanna is celebrated as one of India's most fearless judges.

Canada ends fast-track visa scheme: How will it affect Indian students?Indian students are concerned after Canada ended its fast-track Student Direct Stream (SDS) visa programme, which allowed quicker study permit processing. The sudden decision has left many aspiring students anxious about their academic plans.

6 bullets, Glock pistol, Jammu meeting: What 3rd Baba Siddique shooter revealedShiv Kumar, the primary shooter responsible for the killing of NCP leader Baba Siddique in Mumbai, was arrested in Uttar Pradesh while attempting to flee to Nepal. He had fired six bullets at Siddique, three of which struck him.

Thank you for the memories: On Vistara's last day, Internet bids fond farewellAs Vistara trended on X, several passengers shared memories and described their experience with the airline in emotional posts.

Huge blast at Indian Oil Corporation's refinery in Vadodara, no casualties so farThe massive blast took place in a storage tank at the Indian Oil Corporation Limited refinery in Vadodara. Plumes of black smoke emanated from the refinery and were visible for several kilometres away from the spot.

Russia shoots down reports of Trump-Putin call: Pure fictionKremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said there was no conversation between Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump, dismissing media reports of their call as "false information" and "pure fiction".

Salman Khan's first pic from heavily guarded sets of Sikandar in HyderabadActor Salman Khan has been shooting Sikandar amid four-tier security with 50–70 personnel at Hyderabad's Falaknuma Palace. The actor's first official picture from the sets is now going viral on social media.

'Modi Parivar' or 'Gandhi Parivar', choose carefully: Revanth Reddy to minorities Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy asked minorities to decide their political alliances wisely, stressing that supporting the 'Modi Parivar' could risk the loss of key reservations and policies for the community.

However, he left fans disappointed by not confirming Rohit Sharma's availability for the first Test.

Gerald Cooetzee is getting some IPL attention: Dale Steyn hails all-round heroicsDale Steyn hailed Gerald Cooetzee for his all-round heroics vs India in the T20I series so far. Steyn said that the all-rounder would be on the radar of IPL franchises ahead of the IPL 2025 mega auction.

Dinesh Karthik demands Varun Chakravarthy's selection for Champions Trophy 2025Former India wicketkeeper batter Dinesh Karthik has asked for wrist spinner Varun Chakravarthy's selection in the team for the Champions Trophy 2025.

Gautam Gambhir plays down pressure, backs Virat and Rohit to shine in AustraliaAhead of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Australia, India's head coach Gautam Gambhir attended a press conference in Mumbai, where he confidently addressed tough questions. While he defended under-pressure captain Rohit Sharma and star batter Virat Kohli, affirming their "incredible hunger" to perform, Gambhir did not confirm Rohit's availability for the first Test.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
